rComments: Extremely intelligent and very succinct, favorite teacher of all time. Can ask him any question and he will be able to give you a well thought out response instantly.

He is extremely clear and concise. His accent is never a problem. Homework is REALLY tough and worth a lot, but tests are easier and graded very fairly. He is very helpful and patient in office hours. Definitely one of my favorite math professors. I didn't find is lectures boring at all. You just have to love math.

Thorough presentation of difficult material. He expects you to know it well on his tests, but provides a review sheet. Do all those problems, and you'll do great on the tests. Slow pace as he added extra examples not in the book. We did not get as far as originally planned. Not an exciting lecturer but usually clear, you can tell he loves math.

Generally very clear; a challenging course to follow sometimes, but he cares about student progress and puts effort into his lectures. Probably better for 105A than B since he has taught it more. He is fair.

He is quiet in lecture like people say but he explains concepts very well and is always receptive to questions.  He also usually has a good sense of the things people get confused over so asking questions and going to office hours is extremely helpful.  He is also a fair grader and his actual tests are usually easier than his practice tests.

Erhardt is very shy and quiet, which makes it tough to follow along sometimes. You'll have to work hard to stay awake and keep paying attention. If you can follow along, his explanations are clear and he's certainly knowledgeable. HW is hard, but tests are fairly easy. Ehrhardt's not bad if you can pay attention and learn on your own.

Awful, so far. This class sucks and I feel like I have learned absolutely nothing from lecture. He is by far the most boring professor I have ever had and I will be lucky if I pass this class. Hire a tutor and try and get through his accent, terrible hand writing, and boring lecture. Good luck all. Suggestion: try and find another professor

He seems a bit awkward when he's lecturing because he doesn't look at the class.  It can get dull. He also has an accent, but he's understandable. He not a bad teacher though.  I went to office hours a lot and found him really patient and helpful.  He's also really fair with grading.  I'd take a class with him again.
i thought he was a good professor. i managed an a despite not studying too hard. just do your hw, take notes in lecture and ask the ta if you dont understand anything.

What! I don't know what you guys are talking about. He may be boring during lecture but the TESTS are so easy if you have spent some time going throug the textbook. I also felt I over studied most of the time and the curve is just insane that bumped my grade well up over 100 percent each time.
Once you get used to the accent, he's actually a very good professor. Though he is shy, he does demonstrate a passion for the material, occasionally going onto tangents, but without losing focus.

He's an awful lecturer and won't teach you anything interesting. I have nearly fallen asleep in class more than once. He's also extremely shy and is no help outside of lecture. He is only kind of bad; you just won't learn nearly as much as if you had another teacher.

Strong accent and hard to understand.  Although it's clear he understands the material, he doesn't do a very good job of explaining it.  He often goes into great depth and demonstrates complex problems then gives much simplier problems on tests, so going to lectures is almost pointless.

I loveeeeeee Ehrhardt!!! The accent isn't that bad--you just have to get used to it.  The exams are very straightforward and fair, but still rather difficult.  As long as you stay awake during the class and go to section, it's fine.  and ehrhardt answering the phone is hilarious for some reason...
He only uses symbols when explaining math, no numbers, also he is very hard to understand....I don't know why he still teaches

This teacher was a nightmare. The class averaged something like 25 out of 100 on the first midterm we had. I think someone mentioned something like 40% of students failed each test. That's after a giant curve where he adds like 40 points to your grade. My TA said he was the hardest professor he had ever TAd for over his 5years working as a TA.

He was a fast lecturer and writer so get as much out of office hours from him or ur TAs asap because he puts A LOT on the tests, which are pretty long. His curve was huge due to the fact that almost 40% of 19B had a D or an F on their midterms. 2 midterms, couple of quizzes and the torturous final. STUDY HARD!

Excellent teaching style. Very approachable. His accent throws some people off, but it's far from incomprehensible. If you DEMAND perfect English, then it'll irk you, but otherwise it's a non-issue. His tests do TEST your understanding of the concepts, so be prepared to learn or, if not, to fail. I'd only recommend this professor to math majors.

TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE DROP IT NOW!!!! AWFUL accent, WORST TEACHER I EVER HAD, his handwriting is COMPLETELY ILLEGIBLE. ****. He got a TA that lied to me and threatened me!!! I have post traumatic stress disorder now. No matter how smart you think you are.... This guy will make you his ****.
No Comments
torsten ehrhardt was a very good teacher.  he explained things very clearly, and was very helpful when i went to his office hours.  you have to do all of the homework and understand it to get an a.
Bad English, bad class, bad teaching style....bad.

Lectures are extremely boring and unhelpful for the most part. His accent makes lectures a bit difficult to follow, even after you get used to it. Tests are unreasonably long and questions are 5x tougher than examples given in lectures.
Beware! Lecture are extremely boring and do not involve students whatsoever. Tests are very long and difficult. He puts some stuff on the test thats not in the book. Lectures do not help at all.

Looking back, this professor's lectures probably confused me more than anything, I probably learned more about each chapter in the course through review sessions and sections.  He really seems to neglect any of the students'  questions about the topics he is talking about and leaves them to try to figure it out amongst themselves. Needs improvement
This class is designed to make you fail. Tests are impossibly long and lectures are extremely difficult to understand.

Torsten does not seem to have much respect for undergraduates in general. His accent is very thick, and it takes a few lectures before you get used to it. His examples are long, drawn-out, and complicated. To learn something from this professor requires your entire attention to his lecture, and even then it is difficult to understand the concept.

He makes 19B really difficult to understand concepts that the book explains way better. Lecture makes no sense and you'll only learn well in section. Online Homeowrk is also strange for this class, if you can learn on your own with him as your prof. you can pull a grade but dont expect to get a good grade, thank goodness for curves on his long exam

Very thick accent. Uses easiest examples of problems in class, and assigns hardest problems in both midterms and homework. If you find yourself forsaken enough to be in his class....drop it before it kills you.
